intro: Ormocarpum somalense, commonly known as the Somali starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showing a high degree of drought tolerance. Its leaves are palmate, and the flowers are usually white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. The fruit, which is edible, has a texture similar to a starfruit, hence its common name.
